verses.kjv: Now it came to pass in the fourteenth year of king Hezekiah, that Sennacherib king of Assyria came up against all the defenced cities of Judah, and took them.
verses.web: Now in the fourteenth year of king Hezekiah, Sennacherib king of Assyria attacked all of the fortified cities of Judah and captured them.
verses.ct: In the 14th year of King Hezekiah's reign, King Sennacherib of Assyria attacked all the fortified cities of Judah and captured them.

verses.kjv: And the king of Assyria sent Rabshakeh from Lachish to Jerusalem unto king Hezekiah with a great army. And he stood by the conduit of the upper pool in the highway of the fuller’s field.
verses.web: The king of Assyria sent Rabshakeh from Lachish to Jerusalem to king Hezekiah with a large army. He stood by the aqueduct from the upper pool in the fuller’s field highway.
verses.ct: The king of Assyria sent his field commander, Rabshakeh, from Lachish to Jerusalem with a massive army to confront King Hezekiah. Rabshakeh took his position by the aqueduct of the upper pool, along the road to the washerman's field.

verses.kjv: Then came forth unto him Eliakim, Hilkiah’s son, which was over the house, and Shebna the scribe, and Joah, Asaph’s son, the recorder.
verses.web: Then Eliakim the son of Hilkiah, who was over the household, and Shebna the scribe, and Joah, the son of Asaph, the recorder came out to him.
verses.ct: Three officials came out to meet him: Eliakim son of Hilkiah, who managed the royal household, Shebna the court secretary, and Joah son of Asaph, the royal recorder.

verses.kjv: And Rabshakeh said unto them, Say ye now to Hezekiah, Thus saith the great king, the king of Assyria, What confidence is this wherein thou trustest?
verses.web: Rabshakeh said to them, “Now tell Hezekiah, ‘The great king, the king of Assyria, says, “What confidence is this in which you trust?
verses.ct: Rabshakeh told them, "Deliver this message to Hezekiah: 'The great king, the king of Assyria, asks: What exactly are you putting your confidence in?

verses.kjv: I say, sayest thou, (but they are but vain words) I have counsel and strength for war: now on whom dost thou trust, that thou rebellest against me?
verses.web: I say that your counsel and strength for the war are only vain words. Now in whom do you trust, that you have rebelled against me?
verses.ct: You claim to have strategy and military strength, but those are nothing but empty words. So who are you really counting on, that you would dare rebel against me?

verses.kjv: Lo, thou trustest in the staff of this broken reed, on Egypt; whereon if a man lean, it will go into his hand, and pierce it: so is Pharaoh king of Egypt to all that trust in him.
verses.web: Behold, you trust in the staff of this bruised reed, even in Egypt, which if a man leans on it, it will go into his hand and pierce it. So is Pharaoh king of Egypt to all who trust in him.
verses.ct: Look — you're leaning on Egypt, and Egypt is nothing but a splintered walking stick. If you lean on it, it stabs right through your hand. That's exactly what Pharaoh king of Egypt does to everyone who trusts in him.

verses.kjv: But if thou say to me, We trust in the LORD our God: is it not he, whose high places and whose altars Hezekiah hath taken away, and said to Judah and to Jerusalem, Ye shall worship before this altar?
verses.web: But if you tell me, ‘We trust in LORD our God,’ isn’t that he whose high places and whose altars Hezekiah has taken away, and has said to Judah and to Jerusalem, ‘You shall worship before this altar?’ ”
verses.ct: And if you tell me, 'We trust in the LORD our God' — isn't he the one whose high places and altars Hezekiah tore down, telling Judah and Jerusalem, 'You must worship only at this one altar'?"

verses.kjv: Now therefore give pledges, I pray thee, to my master the king of Assyria, and I will give thee two thousand horses, if thou be able on thy part to set riders upon them.
verses.web: Now therefore, please make a pledge to my master the king of Assyria, and I will give you two thousand horses, if you are able on your part to set riders on them.
verses.ct: "Here, let me make you a wager with my master, the king of Assyria: I'll give you 2,000 horses — if you can even find enough men to ride them.

verses.kjv: How then wilt thou turn away the face of one captain of the least of my master’s servants, and put thy trust on Egypt for chariots and for horsemen?
verses.web: How then can you turn away the face of one captain of the least of my master’s servants, and put your trust on Egypt for chariots and for horsemen?
verses.ct: You can't even stand up to the lowest-ranking officer among my master's servants, and yet you're counting on Egypt for chariots and horsemen?

verses.kjv: And am I now come up without the LORD against this land to destroy it? the LORD said unto me, Go up against this land, and destroy it.
verses.web: Have I come up now without LORD against this land to destroy it? LORD said to me, “Go up against this land, and destroy it.” ’ ”
verses.ct: And do you think I marched against this land without the LORD's approval? The LORD himself told me, 'Go attack that land and destroy it.'"

verses.kjv: Then said Eliakim and Shebna and Joah unto Rabshakeh, Speak, I pray thee, unto thy servants in the Syrian language; for we understand it: and speak not to us in the Jews’ language, in the ears of the people that are on the wall.
verses.web: Then Eliakim, Shebna and Joah said to Rabshakeh, “Please speak to your servants in Aramaic, for we understand it. Don’t speak to us in the Jews’ language in the hearing of the people who are on the wall.”
verses.ct: Then Eliakim, Shebna, and Joah said to Rabshakeh, "Please speak to us in Aramaic — we understand it. Don't speak to us in Hebrew where the people on the wall can hear you."

verses.kjv: But Rabshakeh said, Hath my master sent me to thy master and to thee to speak these words? hath he not sent me to the men that sit upon the wall, that they may eat their own dung, and drink their own piss with you?
verses.web: But Rabshakeh said, “Has my master sent me only to your master and to you, to speak these words, and not to the men who sit on the wall, who will eat their own dung and drink their own urine with you?”
verses.ct: But Rabshakeh replied, "Do you think my master sent me to say these things only to you and your master? No — my message is for those men sitting on the wall too, the ones who will end up eating their own dung and drinking their own urine right alongside you."

verses.kjv: Then Rabshakeh stood, and cried with a loud voice in the Jews’ language, and said, Hear ye the words of the great king, the king of Assyria.
verses.web: Then Rabshakeh stood, and called out with a loud voice in the Jews’ language, and said, “Hear the words of the great king, the king of Assyria!
verses.ct: Then Rabshakeh stood up and shouted in Hebrew so everyone could hear: "Listen to the words of the great king, the king of Assyria!

verses.kjv: Thus saith the king, Let not Hezekiah deceive you: for he shall not be able to deliver you.
verses.web: The king says, ‘Don’t let Hezekiah deceive you; for he will not be able to deliver you.
verses.ct: The king says: 'Don't let Hezekiah fool you. He cannot save you.

verses.kjv: Neither let Hezekiah make you trust in the LORD, saying, The LORD will surely deliver us: this city shall not be delivered into the hand of the king of Assyria.
verses.web: Don’t let Hezekiah make you trust in LORD, saying, “LORD will surely deliver us. This city won’t be given into the hand of the king of Assyria.” ’
verses.ct: Don't let Hezekiah convince you to trust in the LORD by saying, "The LORD will certainly rescue us — this city will never fall to the king of Assyria."

verses.kjv: Hearken not to Hezekiah: for thus saith the king of Assyria, Make an agreement with me by a present, and come out to me: and eat ye every one of his vine, and every one of his fig tree, and drink ye every one the waters of his own cistern;
verses.web: Don’t listen to Hezekiah, for the king of Assyria says, ‘Make your peace with me, and come out to me; and each of you eat from his vine, and each one from his fig tree, and each one of you drink the waters of his own cistern;
verses.ct: Stop listening to Hezekiah.' The king of Assyria says: 'Make peace with me and surrender. Then each of you will eat from your own vine and your own fig tree and drink water from your own cistern —

verses.kjv: Until I come and take you away to a land like your own land, a land of corn and wine, a land of bread and vineyards.
verses.web: until I come and take you away to a land like your own land, a land of grain and new wine, a land of bread and vineyards.
verses.ct: until I come and relocate you to a land just as good as yours, a land full of grain and wine, a land of bread and vineyards.'

verses.kjv: Beware lest Hezekiah persuade you, saying, The LORD will deliver us. Hath any of the gods of the nations delivered his land out of the hand of the king of Assyria?
verses.web: Beware lest Hezekiah persuade you, saying, “LORD will deliver us.” Have any of the gods of the nations delivered their lands from the hand of the king of Assyria?
verses.ct: "Don't let Hezekiah mislead you by saying, 'The LORD will rescue us.' Has any god of any nation ever saved his land from the king of Assyria?

verses.kjv: Where are the gods of Hamath and Arphad? where are the gods of Sepharvaim? and have they delivered Samaria out of my hand?
verses.web: Where are the gods of Hamath and Arpad? Where are the gods of Sepharvaim? Have they delivered Samaria from my hand?
verses.ct: Where are the gods of Hamath and Arphad? Where are the gods of Sepharvaim? Did any of them rescue Samaria from my hand?

verses.kjv: Who are they among all the gods of these lands, that have delivered their land out of my hand, that the LORD should deliver Jerusalem out of my hand?
verses.web: Who are they among all the gods of these countries that have delivered their country out of my hand, that LORD should deliver Jerusalem out of my hand?’ ”
verses.ct: Out of all the gods of these lands, which one saved his country from me? So what makes you think the LORD can save Jerusalem from my hand?"

verses.kjv: But they held their peace, and answered him not a word: for the king’s commandment was, saying, Answer him not.
verses.web: But they remained silent, and said nothing in reply, for the king’s commandment was, “Don’t answer him.”
verses.ct: The people stayed silent and didn't say a word in response, because King Hezekiah had given strict orders: "Don't answer him."

verses.kjv: Then came Eliakim, the son of Hilkiah, that was over the household, and Shebna the scribe, and Joah, the son of Asaph, the recorder, to Hezekiah with their clothes rent, and told him the words of Rabshakeh.
verses.web: Then Eliakim the son of Hilkiah, who was over the household, and Shebna the scribe, and Joah, the son of Asaph, the recorder, came to Hezekiah with their clothes torn, and told him the words of Rabshakeh.
verses.ct: Then Eliakim son of Hilkiah, the household manager, Shebna the secretary, and Joah son of Asaph, the recorder, went back to Hezekiah with their clothes torn in distress and reported everything Rabshakeh had said.
